subject: Ethics
title: Tax Avoidance vs Tax Evasion
description: A 60-second lesson on Tax Avoidance vs Tax Evasion.

hook.text: Apple earned $74 billion overseas and paid almost no tax on it. Illegal? No. That's the problem.

buildup.text: Tax evasion is illegalâ€”hiding income or lying on returns. Tax avoidance is legalâ€”exploiting loopholes in the code.

discovery.text: Companies use shell companies, transfer pricing, and tax havens to shift profits to low-tax jurisdictions legally.

twist.text: The countries losing tax revenue are the same ones providing roads, courts, and educated workers these companies use.

climax.text: In 2021, 136 countries agreed to a 15% global minimum corporate tax. Enforcement remains the hard part.

punchline.text: Legal and ethical aren't synonyms. Especially in tax law.

quiz.question: What is the difference between tax avoidance and tax evasion?
options: There is no difference; both are illegal
Tax avoidance exploits legal loopholes; tax evasion is illegal
Tax evasion is legal; tax avoidance is illegal
